definition: clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

sentences.english: Overdoing this class is shifting the pendulum.
sentences.chinese: 我們要做的就像是改變鐘擺幅度。

sentences.english: Two types of pendulums are available.
sentences.chinese: 我公司可提供兩種類型的鐘擺。

sentences.english: Each cord was a pendulum, just as each rod had been.
sentences.chinese: 每根繩子就像木竿一樣成了鐘擺。

sentences.english: The pendulum of the old clock swung back and forth.
sentences.chinese: 那座老鐘的鐘擺來回地擺動。

sentences.english: Maybe they give in, and the pendulum swings back into sweetness.
sentences.chinese: 也許他們會屈服，然後鐘擺會擺回原來的甜蜜。

sentences.english: Good clocks have pendulums which are automatically pensated for temperature changes.
sentences.chinese: 好的鐘擺可以主動賠償溫度造成的溫差。

sentences.english: His habits of mind had the regular swing of a pendulum.
sentences.chinese: 他精神的習性有如鐘擺的來回擺動。

sentences.english: But expect Latin America’s political pendulum to start swinging.
sentences.chinese: 但是預期拉丁美洲的政治鐘擺會開始搖擺。

sentences.english: A large pendulum swung back and forth inside the grandfather clock.
sentences.chinese: 在老式落地座鐘裏面有一個大鐘擺在擺來擺去。

sentences.english: But in the recent decades, the pendulum has swung in the opposite direction.
sentences.chinese: 但最近一二十年，鐘擺轉到相反的方向去了。

sentences.english: Just like a pendulum likes to swing back and forth at a specific rate or frequency;
sentences.chinese: 就像鐘擺以特定的頻率來回來去擺動。

definition: see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to force someone to do something
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
